title: Bug 50016 - Bad division of responsibility around isUserInRole and new Request login and logout methods
description:
There are 2 similar problems that have a bad division of responsibility.

1. Request.isUserInRole tries to prevent JACC implementations and is also wrong. In the current Tomcat implementation, roleRef mappings are first applied to the supplied role and then the target role is tested. However, JACC requires that this be implemented by constructing a roleRef permission with the current servlet name and the supplied (not mapped) role.

2. The implementation of the new login and logout methods is excessively intrusive into the internals of the authentication. Checking which known Authenticator is installed to see if it supports user/password login is overly restrictive since other authenticators might be installed.
OB:
The current implementation of Request.isUserInRole should be modified to comply with JACC requirements by constructing a roleRef permission with the current servlet name and the supplied role.

The implementation of the new login and logout methods should be revised to be less intrusive into the internals of authentication. Instead of checking which known Authenticator is installed, a more flexible approach should be used to support other authenticators that might be installed.
